strapiPost.title: Spring into March with these NWA Events & Attractions
strapiPost.content:
As warmer temperatures and longer days approach, more events seem to be springing up everywhere in NWA. Tired of your monotonous quarantine routine? Fear not!

  • For chilly nights: Spend time at the Winter Glow at The Momentary in Bentonville, which serves up craft drinks to be enjoyed at a table-side fire pit. Top it off with a beverage from RÃ˜DE Bar and grub at the Momentary Food Truck.
  • Dreaming of Midsummer: The Walton Arts Center will be featuring socially-distanced performances of A Midsummer Night's Dream on March 12th and 13th.
  • Tinker away: The Scott Family Amazeum in Bentonville in hosting a family workshop called, "Little Tinkers: Oh the Things You Can Tinker" on March 13th.
  • Fayetteville Farmer's Market: Expected to open for shopping March 20 at the historic Fayetteville Downtown Square.
  • Succulents 101: The Botanical Garden of the Ozarks will be hosting a Succulent 101 Make & Take Class on March 7th in Fayetteville.
  • More events HERE!
